poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: Silvershod hoofed it. Not hooked, for a spell, To the sexual verbs have and be, I went on a spending spree: books. Yes I know they're hiding the carpet But who gives a tarnished hoot? The moonatic's Hooped with a nicotine rainbow. Buy me this coin - Athena's Owl, A silver bullet champed at the bit. Slip it under my tongue when I leave you.
